The cutest eyebrows, definitely. ((:

Your view on yourself:

You are down-to-earth and people like you because you are so straightforward. You are an efficient problem solver because you will listen to both sides of an argument before making a decision that usually appeals to both parties.

The type of girlfriend/boyfriend you are looking for:

You are a true romantic. (there's more.. hahahaa!)

Your views on education

Education is very important in life. You want to study hard and learn as much as you can.

The right job for you:

You're a practical person and will choose a secure job with a steady income. Knowing what you like to do is important. Find a regular job doing just that and you'll be set for life.

How do you view success:

You are afraid of failure and scared to have a go at the career you would like to have in case you don't succeed. Don't give up when you haven't yet even started! Be courageous. (this just gave me the motivation I've been lacking. yay!) 

What are you most afraid of:

You are concerned about your image and the way others see you. This means that you try very hard to be accepted by other people. It's time for you to believe in who you are, not what you wear.

Who is your true self:

You are mature, reasonable, honest and give good advice. People ask for your comments on all sorts of different issues. Sometimes you might find yourself in a dilemma when trapped with a problem, which your heart rather than your head needs to solve.

Not a huge believer of such tests, but this one proved to be quite true. FYI, they have r/ships stuffs that I decided to omit. Haha, try it. See if it's accurate. (: http://www.quizbox.com/personality/test82.aspx

Met wee and maddy ystd. (:

At least I was happy for a while.

School has started. First time ever that first day back was awful fun! Man, everyone was so blardy high. Laughing and joking and touching. Wahahaa!

hey babeh, I'm proud of you. you did your best and you gave it your all. so don't fret, yea? whatever it is, always know i'm here. ((:

Complications, that I am (amidst it all) glad for. (:

Being the biggest in number, in terms of age as well, we're the most difficult to handle. Everyone has their own views and are stubborn in the things they believe. We don't believe in the rountines people place before us, and we only attend sessions with the promise of fun. It's hard not to influence the kids, as much as we don't want to. Then again, we may be easily influenced ourselves. That is, only by our friends. Ha! We're the loudest and the live of a party, but the lowest and silent at camps. We don't see how whatever is said on a Friday or a Sunday may be applicable in our lives, but we come anyway. We make stupid comments and do shite stuff, that I wonder if we'll ever regret it. Then again, it's all in the name of fun. And fun is all we need. Fun, laughter, gum and rum. Maybe we'll learn, someday. (:

Well, I have been able to unleash my 'maternal instincts' around this awful lot, that despite it all, I do love and appreciate. :D

I cannot hold on and I cannot let go.
You have 7 seconds before it's too late to go.

When school starts, chinese will be replaced with conversational malay. Can improve me malay! Awesome! Haha! (:
Oh, I am blardy un-fit. ): Training is not helping, bleh. Hope you're feeling better, Rah. Heal well! ((:

Tastes like candy canes at Christmas.
Squeeeee!! :D

Hola, new bass! Sunburst, real sweet. (: I foresee Cedric and I fighting over it. Heh. The guy who sold it to us wanted to let it go cause he bought himself a Thunderbird. Quick, go, "Wah!!". Yes, it's awesome I tell you. But the bass that he sold was nice to play and the sound's great! Matt and I weren't really expecting that, so yea.. Good lots. :D

As Alicia puts it, I'm a confused musician. I don't know which is 'my instrument' and I just go around making noise on all the availables. I have jumped three instruments in less than a year. Haha, that is pretty quick! I think it's because I find myself being unable to progress in that particular instrument. I don't know if it's due to a lack of opportunity or whether I'm just not motivated enough to try and improve myself. I would believe it's more of the latter. Sigh. Then again, it may be due to the absence of people in the ministry. Say, when our drummer decides to mia, and the worship leader requests drums, I fill the space. So, right now, I have two choices. Well, somewhat.. 1) Switch back to guitar, and learn to experiment with all the stuffs. This will definitely upset the schedule though. 2) Choose between bass or drums, and stick to it! Must learn steps/riffs and fill-ins respectively! How now brown cow? I will definitely need to replace people still. Rarr.

Open up my eyes to the things unseen.
Show me how to love like you have loved me.
Break my heart for what breaks yours,
Everything I am for your kingdom's cause,
As I walk from earth into eternity.

It has been a fulfilling 4 years in the music ministry. Or is it 5? Can't remember if I started playing in sec 1 or 2, maybe it was in primary school. Doubt it. Anyhow, these years have seen my struggles to make good music as well as praise. More often than not, we get caught up in the need to sound good, the need for perfect timings, essential drum fills, guitar solos, bass riffs and what nots. Yes, it is important to sound good, but in our search for excellence, have we ever wondered what we're doing it for? Is it to satisfy the demands of the perfectionist that lie within us as artistes, or for His glory alone?

Having been asked to play for z a few months back when their 'jamming' thing was still going on, I was really faced with this dilemma. Every practice incoporated both the spiritual aspects that we needed as well as the strive for perfection. And somehow the latter overode the former. Sigh. And even as I watch the new group play on fridays, I really wonder why they do it. Is it due to the fact that they just want to serve in a ministry (cause it's impt to) or cause they want to do it for Him? My little boy is highly adventurous and always tries to do solos (i might have to admit he might be even better than me), but he is starting to get caught up in that web. What is it all worth for then? All for nothing?

Been listening to many of the Hillsong United songs, and the build-ups are so amazing that it makes goose pimples appear. That is what I call, good music. But, good music, without a heart for God, is nothing. They have both! And should we not strive to achieve that? The current parctices for the 27th have been questioned by GY. I hope there will be a balance.

Why have they not looked for me for Sunday services? ):

Maybe we're destined for greater things that this.
Maybe there's nothing we should be ashamed of.
Maybe we were built to be an infrastructure for others.
Maybe, we could be happy with support received.
Maybe, just maybe..

If there was you and me.

I have to face the truth.
No one could ever look at me like you do,
Like something worth holding on to.

Babe, the ball's in your court.
Sigh.

The only reason why I regret going to Cambridge is because Harvard's Din and Tonics performed during our National Day Celebrations. How could they do this to me?! Gah! Blardy unfair. But then again, I'm not complaining la. I really miss Cambridge. Sigh. ): Having wine gums I bought from there now (yah, haven't finished yet) just makes me mopey.

Chinese is tomorrow. After 11 years of one of my most dreaded papers, it's finally going to be over tomorrow! Am def going to give it my all, and do my best. I can do this!! :D After this hurdle comes PW. Even after having about 4 practices (or maybe even more), I'm still lacking the confidence I used to have in SJC. Didn't use to get horrid nerves while addressing an even larger audience. Have to work on getting that back.

Training ystd lasted about 4.5 hours. Never been so long before, but it has to be one of the most fun trainings I've had so far. Am looking forward to even more. The sprinting after the ball one was plenty fun! Heh. Def managed to burn off the weekend's worth of chocolate cakes, mos, etc.

And a Cajon is prolly one of the coolest instruments ever. (:

- gorillaz

Remember how'd I'd sing for you,
A lullaby ever so bliss.
Rest a smile on your face,
Wipe the tears in your eye.

And now..
Even as you've gone away,
I still sing..

Instrument in hand,
Aged and torn.
Rust- a love now lost.
Leaves my skin to bleed.

Just as my sould bleeds..
How do you  prevent being misunderstood?

Did I see what I thought I saw?
Of secrets, betrayal, happiness and love.
Where's the trust that's been keeping you these past years?
Of whispers, guitars, tears and rust.

What was that about? I don't know if it was a deliberate attempt or whether you just never really saw. Then again, it was really obvious and I'm sure you noticed. How did that happen? You looked away instantly. Instantly. I'm not surprised at what I'm feeling. Afterall, I've always had great admiration for you. You probably mean more than goldfishes. Bah! I just want to know what visited today. Oh gosh, what went wrong? |:

Since I've been transferred over to the 'bass'-ist kiddos, I've been yearning to get one for myself. The dreams of an electric still remains of course. (: Les paul in corps in driving me nuts. So yesh, I was thinking of a pretty shiny red one like this!
 
Then again, a cheery one would be nice. Haha. This explains the picture below, besides the fact that Dougie's pretty cute. But.. He's not the reason why this picture is here hokay. Couldn't find a nice un-pixelated picture of his glow-in-the-dark green bass, hence the video. It's plain sick and not to mention, gorgeous. Nice, cute song anyway. Yes, pea? Heheh. :P
